instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the discrimination of Shigella spp.?
Output: Surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) spectra were used in the discrimination of Shigella spp.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the discrimination of Shigella spp.?
Output: Convolutional Layer, MaxPooling Layer, and Fully Connected Layer were used in the discrimination of Shigella spp.

instruction: What metric was chosen to assess the predictive capacities of the different models in the discrimination of Shigella spp.?
Output: The metric chosen to assess the predictive capacities of the different models in the discrimination of Shigella spp. was prediction accuracy.

instruction: How did the researchers assess the predictive capacities of the different machine learning models used in the discrimination of Shigella spp.?
Output: The researchers assessed the predictive capacities of the different machine learning models by constructing and evaluating four supervised learning models based on Random Forest (RF), Support Vector Machine (SVM), Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), and One-Dimensional Multi-Scale CNN (1DMSCNN). They compared the performance of these models in accurately distinguishing four Shigella spp. The results showed that the 1DMSCNN model achieved the best performance.

instruction: How does the One-Dimensional Multi-Scale CNN model compare to traditional methods in accurately distinguishing between the four Shigella spp. in the context of the study's purpose?
Output: The One-Dimensional Multi-Scale CNN (1DMSCNN) model outperformed traditional methods in accurately distinguishing between the four Shigella spp. in the context of the study's purpose. The study compared four supervised learning models: Random Forest (RF), Support Vector Machine (SVM), Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), and 1DMSCNN. Among these models, 1DMSCNN achieved the best performance in terms of predictive capacity. It was able to quickly and accurately distinguish between the different Shigella spp. based on the unique barcodes generated through surface enhanced Raman spectroscopy (SERS) spectral deconvolution. Therefore, the 1DMSCNN model was found to be the most effective in accurately discriminating between the four Shigella spp. in this study.
